content.text: During my favorite vacation, I traveled with my best friend to the magical town Santiago, in Nuevo León, Mexico. I asked the locals for recommendations on the best spots to visit. We believed their advice and called a local tour guide to explore the town. We visited the main square, the History Museum and “La Boca” dam. We liked trying new foods and loved indulging in the local delicacies like machacado con huevo which consists of dried and shredded beef cooked with scrambled eggs. Machacado con huevo is often enjoyed for breakfast and is commonly served with tortillas, refried beans, and salsa. We wore the traditional clothing of the region and wrote about our experiences in a travel blog. We took several pictures in the town. The sound of nature of the town helped us forget about our worries and made us feel at peace. While others worked or brought their laptops to continue their tasks, we simply enjoyed the moment. We saw beautiful sunsets. We even got to to witness a local artist painting a beautiful landscape. However, as all good things must stop, the vacation came to an end. We said goodbye to the breathtaking views and left with unforgettable memories. We bought souvenirs to bring back home, including traditional crafts and unique gifts. As time passed, we got back to our daily routine, but Santiago Nuevo León always held a special place in our hearts.
